lokacija.opis: Sjeverna vrata predstavljala su glavni ulaz u palaču iz Salone te su zbog svog značaja u 16. st. prozvana „Zlatna vrata“. Ulaz u palaču branile su dvije osmerokutne kule neposredno uz vanjska vrata i unutrašnje obrambeno dorište (tzv. propugnakul), na kojem su se nalazila unutrašnja vrata. Sjeverna vrata jedan su od najsačuvanijih primjera svoje vrste u antičkom graditeljstvu.

Northern gate represented the main entrance to the palace from Salona and because of its importance in the 16th century became known as the "Golden Gate". The entrance to the palace was defended by two octagonal towers next to the outer door and inner defensive courtyard (aka. Propugnakul), which were located inside the door. Northern gate is one of the best preserved examples of their kind in the ancient building.

Ovo je najbolje sačuvana kula palače. Izvorni antički izgled građevine danas je sasvim poznat. Kula je tijekom vremena mijenjala svoju namjenu tako da je prizemlje bilo korišteno kao ranosrednjovjekovna crkva sv. Petra.

This is the best preserved tower of the palace. Original antique appearance of the building today is quite well known. The tower has over time changed their purpose so that the ground floor was used as an early medieval church of St. Peter.

Istočna vrata, od 16. st. nazvana Srebrna vrata, u osnovi ponavljaju oblik Sjevernih vrata sa mnogo skromnijim ukrasnim elementima. Vrata su branile dvije osmerokutne kule, a tkođer je postojalo i unutrašnje obrambeno dvorište (propugnakul).

East Gate, that have been called Silver Gate from the 16th century, essentially repetitive form of the north gate with more modest decorative elements. The door were defended by two octagonal towers and there also existed inner defensive courtyard (propugnakul).

Ugaone kule na južnoj strani Dioklecijanove palače imale su četiri etaže: prizemlje i tri kata. Bile su, dakle, za kat više od sjevernih ugaonih kula zbog nagiba terena od sjevera prema jugu. U samoj kuli nalazio se dio stana prvog splitskog nadbsikupa, koji mu je – prema kronici Tome Arhiđakona-ustupio Sever, jedan od predvodnika salonitanskih građana, što su se uselili u palaču.

Corner towers on the south side of Diocletian's palace had four floors, ground floor and three floors. They were, therefore, for the floor higher of the north tower of the corner due to slope gradient from north to south. In the tower there was a part of the apartment of the first Archbishop of Split, which was - according to chronicle of Thomas the Archdeacon-courtesy of Sever, one of the leaders of Salona citizens, as they moved into the palace.

Zapadna ili „Željezna“ vrata predstavljala su zapadni ulaz u Dioklecijanovu palaču. Osmerokutne kule ovdje su više sačuvane od istočnih, a gotovo u cjelini ostalo je unutrašnje obrambeno dvorište (propugnakul) s unutrašnjim vratima.

Western or "Iron" garte represented the western entrance to Diocletian's Palace. Octagonal towers here are more preserved than the eastern, and almost a whole defensive courtyard (propugnakul) with internal door remained inside.

Prizemni dio južnog pročelja osvijetljavali su uski prozori i vrata po sredini, skromnija u usporedbi s kopnenim ulazima. Mala vrata služila su isključivo za carev pristup lađi, koja je tada mogla pristati blizu ulaza, jer se more prostiralo sve do zidova palače. Nasuprot tome, raskošni gornji kat odgovarao je dugom hodnjiku, koji je služio kao careva šetnica i istovremeno kao pristup drugim odajama Dioklecijanova stana.

The ground floor of the south façade illuminated the narrow windows and doors in the middle, modest in comparison to land entrances. A small door used exclusively for the the emperor's access to the ship, which was then able to land near the entrance, because the sea stretched all the way to the walls of the palace. In contrast, luxurious top floor fit a long hodnjiku, who served as the emperor's promenade and at the same time as access to other chambers of Diocletian's apartments.

Vestibul je bio ulazna dvorana u Dioklecijanov stan. Izvana je nalik velikoj kocki, a unutra ima kružnu dvoranu, koja je bila urešena mramornim pločama. Na vrhu se nalazila kupola s mozaikom, a u nišama su bile skulpture.

Vestibule was the entrance hall in Diocletian's apartment. Outside is a large cube-like, and in a circular hall, which was decorated with marble slabs. At the top was a dome with a mosaic, and in the niches were sculptures.

Gradnjom svoje rezidencije u Dalmaciji car Dioklecijan je želio sebi osigurati ne samo mjesto posljednjeg boravišta nego i trajno počivalište. Radi toga je i njegov Mauzolej sadržajno jedna od najznačajnijih građevina palače, naglašena svojim položajem, volumenom i oblikom. Mauzolej je smješten unutar pravokutnog dvorišta ograđenog visokim zidom.

Built his residence in Dalmatia Emperor Diocletian wanted to provide itself with not only a place of residence than the last and permanent resting place. For this reason, and his mausoleum in content one of the most important buildings of the palace, emphasized his position, volume and shape. Mausoleum is located inside a rectangular yard surrounded by a high wall.

Jupiterov hram u Splitu je hram posvećen bogu Jupiteru, glavnom božanstvu starih Rimljana. Nalazi se u zapadnom dijeluDioklecijanove palače u neposrednoj blizini Peristila, centralnog trga carskog kompleksa. Sagrađen je krajem 3. stoljeća, u vrijeme gradnje carske palače, a vjerojatno već u 6. stoljeću posvećen je u krstionicu sv. Ivana Krstitelja. Pred samim ulazom u hram nalazi se jedna od dvanaest sfingi dopremljenih iz Egipta po naredbi cara Dioklecijana.

Temple of Jupiter in Split is a temple dedicated to the god Jupiter, the main deity of the ancient Romans. It is located in the western dijeluDioklecijanove palace near the Peristyle, the central square of the imperial complex. It was built in the late 3rd century, during the construction of the imperial palace, and probably in the 6th century, is dedicated to the Baptistery of St.. Ivana Baptist. On the entrance to the temple is one of the twelve sphinx brought from Egypt by order of Emperor Diocletian.

Ovo mjesto oblika blagovaone naziva se u antičkoj arhitekturi triklinij, po nazivu ležaja (triclinium), što su se upotrebljavali prilikom blagovanja. Triklinij Dioklecijanove palače nalazio se po sredini istočnog dijela carevog stana. Zapremao je relativno veliku površinu u kojoj se nalazila velika sala, okružena sa trima manjim dvoranama i ulaznim prostorima.

This place shaped as dining room is called in ancient architecture triclinium, by the name of bearings (triclinium), which were used in the dining area. Triclinium of Diocletian's palace was located in the middle of the eastern part of the Emperor's residence. Covered the relatively large surface area in which was a large hall, surrounded by three smaller halls and entrance areas.

Hodnik, koji se pružao uzduž južnog zida u Dioklecijanovoj palači nazvan je kriptoportik. Imao je dvije osnovne fumkcije. U okviru sveukupnog rasporeda Dioklecijanova stana to je bio glavni komunikacijski prostor, kojem se prilazilo iz sredšnje dvorane i iz kojega se potom pristupalo svim drugim odajama na istočnoj i i zapadnoj strani stana. Istovremeno taj je prostor bez sumnje služio kao ugodna šetnica uza zid palače, iz koje se kroz neprekidni niz otvora pružao jedinstveni pogled na luku Aspalathosa i naobližnje otoke srednjodalmatinskog arhipelaga.

The corridor, which stretched along the south wall of the Diocletian's palace is named cryptoporticus. He had two basic functions. As part of the overall layout of Diocletian's apartments this was the main communications room, which was reached from the central hall and from which then approached all other quarters on the east and west side of the apartment. At the same time the space is undoubtedly served as a pleasant promenade along the wall of the palace, from which a succession of openings provided a unique view of the harbor and Asphalatos and the nearby islands of Central Dalmatian archipelago.

Otvoreni prostor pred ulazom u carev stan nazvan je Peristil. Nalazio se na glavnom kardinu (cardo), nekadašnje Dioklecijanove palače i u sjevernom se dijelu križao s njenim glavnimdekumanom (decumanus). S bočnih strana je omeđen s dva reda stupova u korintskom stilu povezanih međusobno lukovima. Bočne strane pročelja su bile ukrašene dvjema sfigama od kojih se jedna i dan-danas nalazi na trgu gotovo savršeno očuvana. Pročelje trga je podjeljeno u dva dijela: gornji vodi u Vestibul, a donji stepenicama u veličanstvenepodrume palače. Pročelje koje vodi u Vestibul bilo je ukrašeno s tri kipa od kojih je jedan predstavljao cara Dioklecijana, drugi boga Jupitera dok treći ostaje nepoznanica.

Open space in front of the entrance into the emperor called the Peristyle. It was located on the main Cardin (Cardo), of the palace in the northern part intersected with her glavnimdekumanom (decumanus). On the sides is bordered by two rows of columns in the Corinthian style interconnected arches. The sides of the facades were decorated with two sfiga one of which is to this day in the square almost perfectly preserved. The front of the square is divided into two parts: the upper water in the vestibule, and the lower stairs in veličanstvenepodrume palace. The facade that leads to the vestibule was decorated with three statues one of which is represented by the Emperor Diocletian, the second of Jupiter while the third remains unknown.

Antičku zgradu istočno od Mauzoleja karakterizira unutrašnje dvorište okruženo stupovima i trijemom, na čijem su se podu nalazila četiri mozaika različitih ukrasnih motiva. Funkcija te zgrade i njezin odnos s ostalim dijelovima palače do sada još nisu razjašnjeni, ali treba imati u vidu okolnost da je južnije od toga nalaza pronađen sklop istočnih termi.

Ancient building east of the mausoleum is characterized by an inner courtyard surrounded by columns and porch, in which the floor was located four mosaic of different decorative motifs. The function of the building and its relationship with other parts of the palace have not yet been clarified, but we should bear in mind the fact that the south of that finding found circuit eastern baths.
Drvene grede otkrivene ispod podne razine supstrukcija palače. (Period: vjerojatno 295.- 305. godine po Kr.)
Beams of wood discovered under the floor level of the substructures of the Palace. (Period: possibly from 295 – 305 AD
Nalaz potječe s područja Dioklecijanove palače, a moguće je i korišten i u sekundarnoj uporabi. (Period: od polovice 4. stoljeća nadalje)
The finding originates from area of the Palace, and it was possibly used for secondary purposes. (Period: from the middle of the 4th century onwards)

Tijesak (sustav) za proizvodnju maslinovog ulja pronađen na podnoj razini iznad antičke faze, kad u srednjovjekovnom razdoblju supstrukcije palače dobivaju nove namjene. (Period: srednjovjekovno razdoblje)

lokacija.ime: Pressure equipment for production of olive oil
lokacija.naslov: Pressure equipment for production of olive oil
lokacija.opis: Pressure equipment (system) for production of olive oil from the Middle Ages, from the time when substructures were used for new purposes, found on the floor level above the ancient phase.

Zapadno od glavne prijamne dvorane nalazila se jedna nešto manja odaja, također s eksedrom na sjevernoj strani, koja je bila sastavni dio istoga prijamnog sklopa. Njezini zidovi u znatnom su dijelu ostali sačuvani i u gornjem katu, uključujući i eksedru, kao i ostatke niša na bočnim zidovima.

To the west of the main reception room was another, somewhat smaller chamber forming a part of the same reception complex, which also had an apse to the north. Its surviving remains comprise the walls preserved to a large degree even at the upper level, including the apse, and niches on the lateral walls.

U rezidenciji vladajućeg cara taj bi se prostor smatrao prijestolnom dvoranom. Iako u splitskoj Dioklecijanovoj palači to nije bio slučaj, ona je položajem i oblikom identificirana kao glavna dvorana stana umirovljenoga cara, koja je pružala dostojan arhitektonski okvir bivšem vladaru, okruženom pažnjom i počastima. Konstrukcija dvorane ima oblik trobrodne dvorane s polukružnom eksedrom na sjevernoj strani. S jedne i druge strane eksedre nalazilo se po jedno spiralno četverokrako stubište kojim se moglo komunicirati s gornjim prostorom. Od same dvorane u gornjem katu su ostali skromni ostaci.

In imperial residences, such a space would have been considered a throne room. Although that was not the case in Diocletian’s palace in Split, its position and shape defined it as the emperor’s main hall which provided a worthy architectural setting to the retired ruler and all the attention and honours surrounding him. Shape of hall has three-aisled basilican hall that had a semi-circular apse (exedra). The exedra was flanked by spiral stairways with four flights of stairs, which communicated directly with the corresponding upper floor. From the upper hall remained modest remains.

Funkcija ove dvorane uzdužnog tlocrta proizlazi iz središnjega položaja unutar stana kao dijela aksijalnog ceremonijalnog sklopa kojim je počasna garda vodila posjetitelje k carevim odajama na zapadnom području carske rezidencije. Dva reda od četiri pilona davali su odgovarajućoj prizemnoj središnjoj dvorani izgled trobrodnoga prostora. Takva je konstrukcija bila potrebna zbog izgradnje unakrsnih bačvastih svodova koji su nosili gornji kat.

Function of this longitudinal hall stems from the central position in the apartments as part of the axis of the ceremonial complex along which the guard of honour took visitors to the emperor’s chambers at the west end of the residence. Two rows of four piers gave the corresponding hall at ground level an appearance of a three-aisled chamber. This construction was necessary due to the construction of cross- vaulted ceilings that bare upper floor.
Ostaci kultnog mjesta – nymphaeum. [ Nimfej (grč. nymphaion) - starogrč. svetište posvećeno nimfama. U rim. doba raskošna fontana ili dio kupališta ]
Remains of a Nymphs’ shrine – nymphaeum [ Nimfej (Gr. Nymphaion ) - ancient Greek sanctuary dedicated to nymphs. In Rome Age sumptuous fountain or part baths ]

Blagovaonicu u rimskim kućama i palačama nazvana je triclinium, pa je tim terminom nazvano i središnje područje istočne polovice Dioklecijanova stana, utvrđeno kao blagovaonica. Dioklecijanov je triklinij zapremao veliku površinu, a obuhvaćao je središnju salu vanjskoga četvrtastog i unutrašnjega osmerokutnog tlocrta, raščlanjenu s četiri polukružne niše.

The dining room in Roman houses and palaces was called triclinium. The name was also used for the central area of the east end of Diocletian’s apartments which was determined to have served as dining room. Diocletian’s triclinium covered a big surface and comprised a central chamber rectangular on the outside and octagonal on the inside whose walls were set with four semi-circular niches.
Dijelovi kamenih cijevi antičke kanalizacije Period: 295. - 305. godine po Kr.

lokacija.ime: Parts of stone pipes from the ancient sewage system
lokacija.naslov: Parts of stone pipes from the ancient sewage system
lokacija.opis: Parts of stone pipes from the ancient sewage system Period: 295 - 305 AD
